title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
text: A timeless picture book following a caterpillar’s transformation through bright, colorful illustrations and simple, joyful storytelling loved by children and adults alike.

title: Where the Wild Things Are
text: A classic story of a boy’s imaginative journey to an island of wild creatures exploring emotions of anger, love, and belonging with stunning artwork.

title: Hair Love
text: A tender story celebrating the bond between a father and his daughter as he helps style her hair for a special day.

title: Goodnight Moon
text: A soothing bedtime story using gentle, rhythmic language and comforting illustrations to lull children to sleep in a quiet, familiar room.

title: The Lorax
text: An environmental classic telling the story of the Lorax, who speaks for the trees, delivering a powerful message about conservation and caring for the planet.

title: Where the Sidewalk Ends
text: An iconic collection of whimsical, funny, and sometimes profound poems and drawings delighting children and adults alike.

title: Winnie the Pooh
text: Gentle stories of Pooh Bear and friends in the Hundred Acre Wood exploring friendship, kindness, and simple joys with warmth and humor.

title: The Little Prince
text: A poetic and philosophical tale of a young prince’s journey through the universe, exploring themes of love, loss, and the essence of human connection.

title: Frog and Toad Are Friends
text: Beloved stories of friendship between Frog and Toad teaching gentle lessons about kindness, patience, and fun with simple, charming prose and illustrations.

title: Curious George
text: Classic tales of a curious little monkey’s adventures delighting children with humor, mischief, and discovery.
